title: Permanently banned off one game
body:
First off I will admit I'm a toxic player. I've truly been trying to reform, and I honestly have gotten much better. It had been at least a month since my last punishment, and I have played very frequently since then. I have avoided flaming almost all together, except for the rare situation where a toxic player is flaming, and I flame back. In my most recent game, I was perma banned. I realize I deserve punishment, but after a month of avoiding toxicity (which is a huge milestone for me where I would get punished just after being unpunished), it feels unfair to have one bad game completely delete my account.

I realize I was toxic in this game, but I feel as if one game isn't enough to justify permanently banning someone.

replies.body: OP, you weren't permabanned for one game with bad behavior. You were permabanned for one _more_ game with bad behavior. One month between telling people things like "xin just shut up and stop losing the game for us," "why are you such an ass," and "report xin zhao" is just more poor behavior than the system is set to tolerate. Given that you had just been suspended and warned that this was your last chance, it just didn't look like you were taking it seriously.

The game impacting troll doesn't always walk away just fine. There have been several threads around here asking about such punishments. A few players have gotten two-week bans from games with one or two possibly-intentional deaths, and by "intentional" I mean "it looks like maybe they weren't quite trying hard enough right then."

If someone was stealing your camps and emote spamming, complaining about it in chat just bothers everyone else and feeds the troll. Report the troll, and submit a ticket with a replay or highlights or something if you want.

Which is why it EVENTUALLY only gets you standard punishment -[going up the punishment tiers](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286)- while the other nets you... an instant 14-day ban? What?

>It had been at least a month since my last punishment, and I have played very frequently since then. I have avoided flaming almost all together, except for the rare situation where a toxic player is flaming, and I flame back.

 It takes more than one month of positivity to restore an account's punishment level. There's no set time period but in general I think it's safe to say it takes 3-4+ months of gameplay to return an account to a normal, safe standing.

 That's with a _positive_ attitude, though. If you're flaming at all (even a little bit or infrequently) your account isn't going to move towards a lower punishment, you halt all progress by doing this.

But why does it still stay at the lowest spot for such a long time? I had already gotten all checkpoints for the bottom honor level, and had shown signs of reforming. But even reformed most previously toxic players will end up having one game, and it happens to almost everyone who has a history of toxicity. It just feels unfair that I was reforming and had one bad game and lose my entire account, along with hundreds of dollars for it.

Edit: The point I'm focusing on is one game. One game for a permaban. If I had flamed three games out of 10 or something, then yea, I'd accept the permaban, because I'd without a doubt deserve it. But for having no punishments in over a month, to losing my account over one bad game just feels incredibly unfair.

Edit2: Also doesn't 3-4 months of being not just a neutral mute-all player, but a player with overwhelming positivity every game feel like a bit too long for someone to have the state reset?

I believe the idea is that people should start changing when they get their first chat restriction, instead of trying to turn 180 at the last warning.

That said, I agree. There should be *some* punishment in between the first Gameplay ban and the Permaban.
